yet selfe ouerruled owne lust f soueraignty wee may omit speake whatsoeuer qualitie proposed subiect shall require permit arise foe god city bee guarded yet reclaiming impious errours haue become good citizen therein others burning extreame violence hate thanklesse redeemer manifest benefit day would speake word holy place thereof flying thether sword foe found life safety wherein glory romaine become persecutor christ barbarian saued christ sake yes church apostle martyr testifie great sacke free g owne h stranger euen thither came rage bloudy enemie euen murder furie stopt euen thither distressed led pittifull foe spared though finding sanctuary least light vpon extend like pitty euen elsewhere raged slaughter comming place forbad law warre elsewhere allowed headlong furie curbed honour attained vnto dignitie regall domination ambition didde preuaile hadde meane continue honour ambition would preuaile amongst people wholly corrupted coueteousnes luxury people alw infected two rome brought forth l would neither keepe good themselues suffer others keepe salust proceeds discourse syllas villanies barbarous blemish commonwealth relation writer agree substance though bee farre patron e slaues warre began cicilie confederate warre one eunus syrrian fained himselfe bee inspired cibels spirit hee gotte together sixtie thousand slaues warre men ouerthrew foure praetor tooke tent length perpenna besieged conquered little cleon cicilian began another warre iland getting huge power ouerthrowing praetor spoyling tent warre aequilius ended italy spartacus chrysus began broke schoole lentulus hee capua gotte forth number seauentyfoure whome great many slaues adioined themselues soone p varenus praetor claudius pulcher legate met first armes ouercame afterward chrysus band marius chap vvhen marius imbrued countryman bloud hauing slaine many aduersaries length foyled forced flie citty gotte time take little breath presently vse tully wordes vpon sodaine cinna marius began bee conquerours againe went heart blouds worthy men light cittie soone came b sylla reuenged barbarous massacre damage state cittie purpose vtter reuenge worse offence punished bene left vnpunished let lucan testifie c wordes excessit medicina modum nimium que secuta est qua morbi duxere manus periere nocentes sed cum iam solo possent superesse nocentes tunc data libertas odijs resoluta que legum frenis ira ruit medicine wrought sore making cure cruell patient indure guilty fell none yet remaining hate riseth full height wrath disdaining lawes reines brake war sylla marius besides fell field whole cittie streetes marketplace theater temple filled dead body question whether conqueror slaughtered many attaine conquest already attained marius first victory returne exile themselues pietie honestie god admired gift suffice enioying true felicitie life attaining eternall true felicitie next vpon earth rule regalitie giuen good man doth returne much good doth vnder rule regalitie contrariwise gouernment wicked harmes themselues farre subiects giueth themselues greater libertie exercise lust subiects haue none owne iniquity answer iniurie soeuer vnrighteous maister doth righteous seruant scourge guilt triall vertue therefore hee good free though hee bee slaue euill slaue though hee bee king hee slaue one man worst vnto many maisters hee affecteth vice according scripture speaking thus hereof whatsoeuer man ouercome hee bondage p l vives good stoicall paradoxe mentioned tully paradox pro muren stoicisme like christianitie wherefore hierome thinkes stoicisme intellectuall part apprehendeth truth intelligibility abstracted bodily formes e spirituall apprehendeth corporall obiects hee saith may prepared certaine theurgike consecration called f teletae teletae receiue spirit angell may see god yet confesseth hee theurgike teletae profit intellectuall part iot see owne god receiue apprehension truth consequently see sweete apparition god teletae cause bee truth discerned vision finally saith reasonable soule liketh better say intellectuall may mount aloft though spirituall part haue th ke preparation spirituall doe attaine preparation yet thereby made capable eternity though distinguish angells daemones placing ayre g skie giue v counsell get amity daemon whereby mount earth death professing meanes one attaine society angells yet doth hee manner openly professe daemon company dangerous saying soule beeing plagued death abhorres adore daemones deceiued deny theurgy hee maketh league betweene god angells dealeth deuillish power either enuy soules purgation el seruile enuy chaldaean saith good man complained endeuour purge soule frustrate reason great artyst enuying goodnesse diured power hee deale holy inuocations bound granting request hee bound saith hee could loose plaine proofe theurgie arte effecting euill well good god men god wrought vpon passion perturbation apuleius lay vpon deuills men alike notwithstanding setled sinlesse eternall peace l vives beare yee greeke nonlatin alphabet b spirit meekenesse followeth considering thy selfe least thou also bee tempted fitte one corrects sinne consider hee might stronge lord holy lord shall weaken aduersaries make conquered hee holy hath made holy also therefore let wise glory wisdome mighty might ritch ritches let glory know god execute iudgements iustice vpon earth hee good proficient knowledge god knoweth god must giue meanes know god hast thou saith apostle thou hast receiued hast thou thine owne boast hee doth right executeth iudgement iustice hee precept would bee common men land sea least thinke life time elsewhere doe iustice iudgement auoide great iudgement flesh therefore earth added confine act within life man beareth earth world hee dieth bequeaths great earth must returne resurrection earth therefore fleshly body must doe iustice iudgement doe selues good hereafter euery one shall receiue according work done body good bad body perished ere shee goe cyrus conquered massagetes onely medled india g w know king sicyonia wee follow eusebius pausanias greekes bookes uarro latines concerning lost two g name king indeed sycionians prometheus sonne iaepellis asia hesiod call mother clymene falling ioue saith higin hist celest many touch grew vpon cause smal sacrifice offer great offrings poore able offord prometheus suttely agreed ioue halfe sacrifice onely bee burnt rest shold reserued vse men ioue consented offer prometheus two bull vnto ioue putteth bone vnder one skin flesh vnder bad ioue choose part ioue good plaine dealing god looking cousnage tooke next hand light bone angry tooke away fire fro mankind could sacrifice prometheus vsing ordinary trickes stole cane full fire elestiall gaue vnto man wherevpon hee bound caucasus eagle set feed continually vpon liuer euer growing againe say prometheus made creature haue fetcht ioue downe often woman prometheus complaint lucian thus answered vulcan mercury thou cousonedst ioue sharing thou stolest fire thou madest men especially woman said made men clay put life fire hee stolne ioue wherevpon sath horace commeth mankind disease feuers seruius saith minerua woundted man worke prometheus promised perfit lackt prometheus affirming hee knew best tooke vp heauen setting sonns chariot gaue cane full fire sent downe man hesiod one place toucheth story higinus saying ioue tooke away fire man prometheus got againe reuenge iniury vulcan ioues command made pandora woman endowed heauenly guifts therefore called pandora pandora sent downe earth mercury giuen guift vnto epimetbeus prometheus brother receaued house opened tunne mischiefes diffused throughout mankinde hope remayning bottom prometheus aeschilus saith bound vpon cancasus thirty thousand yeares neare caspian streights lucian saith caucasus philostratus saith mount hath two toppes furlong distance one inhabitant say vnto prometheus hand bound vita apollon saith lucian eag e say begotten betweene typhon echydna higin say betweene terra tartarus say uulcan made hercules killed shaft set vp skie betweene tropike cancer equinoctiall line prometheus prophecyed vnto ioue lye thetis sonne begat bee greater father loosed prouided must euer weare iron ring vpon finger memory bondage hence came vse ring say lactantius saith first made idol clay stole fire saith pliny lib taught way strike flint keepe cane sure saith diodorus lib hee finde fewell fire first pelasgiues pausanias testifieth ascribe finding fire vnto phoroneus vnto prometheus theophrastus saith tropicall ment inuentions wisdome f taught old iaphets sonne world full wisest man doth hesiod call vnto epimetheus younger brother say hee willingly resigne kingdome thessaly giuing himselfe wholly vnto celestiall contemplation end ascending high mount caucasus behold circumuolution starres posture c descending downe came taught caldees astronomy pollicy thinke fable eagle feeding vpon liuer hath reference doubtfull care arising still one another interpreter apollonius rhodius saith riuer called aquila falling caucasus runnes heart country promethea lying close mount herodotus writeth prometheus king scythia knowing way bring riuer aquila runne kingdome much troubled vntill hercules came thus riuer two agree diodorus saith prometheus king egypt nilus ouer flowed country drowned many inhabitant kill himselfe hercules wisdome found meane reduce riuer proper chanell herevpon nilus swiftnesse course called aquila g yet yes atlas wise epimetheus late prometheus alat one forewit epimetheus witted man warned brother prometheus take gift ioue neglected warning tooke pandora afterwards hesiod saith knew receiued hurt therefore augustine reason ong acute great doctor wee finde wise men hee left confound vse diodorus lib maketh atlas moore sonne caelus brother saturne father hesperides grandfather mercury great astronomer one often ascending mountaine name fro whence might better behold phaenicians egiptians afterwards hee trauelled country knowledge astronomy might well giue life fable heauenbearing e arose inaccessible hight mount atlas seemeth eye vnder sky saith herodotus hated saith pouerishing temple killing brother higinius saith tooke bee celestiall constellation heauen called ophinchus wound triopas hauing taken roofe cere temple couer palace withal enged selfe adacus gaue name vnto ile greece gorg l sarpedon sarpedon h er haue son ioue europa laodam ia bellerophon daughter reigned cilicia apromontory name vtmost part kingdome mela common report king lycia hold strabo lib writing sarpedon brought two colony crete thether dwelt son pandion lycus reigned afterwards leauing name called myniae solymi afterwards though homer make two seuerall people sarpedon slaine menelaus troy great griefe ioue could comptroll destenies herein minos king crete lawgiuer also say minos yonger son iupiter diodor l n hercules tyria syria indeed tyre minos syria phaenicia also syria huge thing sixe hercules doth ly said recken vp eusebius make hercules surnamed delphinas famous phaenicia liue hercules time hercules burnt himselfe oeta argiue must read tyrinthia philostratus saith l antaeus son vnto terra dwelt tingen mauritania thervpon called tingitana lying ouer spaine sheeld saith mela seene cut back elephant hugenesse man earth able weeld inhabitant affirme antaeus reuerence hee bore alwaies fight also little hill forme man lying face vpward say tombe part dimished begin raine neuer ceaseth vntill made vp againe eusebius driueth ouerthrow ant hercules vnto formertimes first hercules conquered hee ith wrastling doth uirgil mention conquest antaeus amongst argiue hercules labour ouid claudian others lay exploit rest vpon son ioue alcmena p oeta mountaine macedonia mela otaean groue last ground argiue hercules euer touched greeke latine bookes filled octa story death nothing famous q owne paine proceeding melancholy breaking vlcers arist probl mention disease politian hath obser ed century festus saith great astronomer burned himselfe time great eclipse confirme opinion diuinity atlas moore taught astronomy shewing greekes sphere giuen gaue occasi feigne hercules bore vp heauen atlas rested shoulder r busyris king egipt e built busyris nomos inhospitable barren soile thence came fa busyris killing guestes heardsmen part would rob spoile passenger weake another reason fable saith diod li slew brother osyris redheaded pacification osyris soule order set downe sacrifice nothing redde ox redheaded men egipt hauing red head country many thence came report busyris massacred stranger osyris tombe cause cruelty busyris indeed euseb saith theeuish king hercules killing set al erichthonius rest assuredly hercules egiptian erichthonius son vulcan earth conspired amphiction deposed pausan hold ioue hauing paine trauell head praied uulcan take axe cleaue start minerua armed leaping dancing uulcan aske wife regard midwifry hee afforded iupiter neede also making ioues thunderbolt fireworkes vsed gyants ioue put vnto virgin choise denies mary man vulcan affring force ioues consent striuing cast sperme vpon ground minerua shaming couered earth hence erichthonius borne hauing lower part snake therefore inuented chariot wherein might ride deformity vnseene virg georg primus erichthonius currus et quatuor ausus iungere ioue hee made cloud like cloud ixion begot centaures sure ixion king thessaly horse first backt plin lib bridle saddle peletronius inuent thessalian dwelt mount pelion first fought horseback virgil goeth farre saying georg frena pelethronii lapithae girosque dedere impositi dorso atque equitem docuere sub armis insultare solo gressus glomerare superbos first pelethronian lapiths gaue bit hotted ring taught armd horsmen sit bound proudly coruet fit hath lucan pharsalia lib primus ab aequorea percussis cuspide saxis thessalicus sonipes hellis ferallibus omen exiluit primus chalybem frenosque momordit spum auit que nouis lapithae domitoris habenis since neptune sea trident stroke rockes first hessalian horse deadly shock dismall signe came forth first bit bruzed fomde lapith rider reines vnused seruius explaining place uirgill saith thus ox certaine king thessaly gadding madly field hee sent men fetch swift enough got vpon horse riding swiftly ox pricked whipped home stable seeing swift course let horse drinke centaures riuer peneus began fable centaures giuing name nonlatin alphabet pricking ox say fable inuented shew swiftly man life passeth swiftnesse horse thus farre seruius palaephatus hath thus wilde buls troubled larissa thessaly ixion proclaimed great rewarde could driue thence youth nephele got vpon horse broken waggon vse droue away easily hauing receiued reward grew proud iniuring ixion himselfe larissaeans called lapithes inuited pirrhas marriage fell rauishing virgin thus began fable centaures horselike bodyes birth clowd nephele city name cloud centaures also lapithes nephele lapithes countrie distinct romaine latines e cerberus begotten cerberus typhon made hideous noise barked hauing fifty neck hesiod theogon thus seneca describeth said bee three gorgon steno euriale medusa daughter phorcus sea monster hesiod saith gorgon three medusa onely mortall theog ouid hath two met one eye betweene vsed course ouer west ethiopia ilands mela calleth gorgones making habitation monster lucan agreeth phars ouer hesperoceras promontory egipt ilands saith pliny gorgon whilom inhabited two day saile lib maine hanno carthage came tooke two woman al rough hairy men swift got skin hung vp monument iunos temple long time carthage tooke gorgon hesperides hesperides iles sayth statius sebosus ly forty day sayle farther gorgon diodorus saith gorgon warlike nation woman lybia whome perseus ouerthrew leader medusa lib medusa fable say neptune lay withall mineruas temple whereat minerua medusa angry turned hayres snake made beheld become stone perseus armed mineruas shield encountred beholding herselfe bright sheeld glasse grew heauy sleepe became stone perseus presently cut head droppes blood fell filled lybia full serpent since fell vpon twigges shrub turned corall thence saith ouid hesiod came pegasus winged horse others say copulation neptune medusa higinus sayth perseus ouercame gorgon thus hauing one eye betweene hee watched time one tooke giue hee suddenly came snatched away threw lake hauing blinded easily foyld iupiter fight told must weare gorgon head would victor whervpon goat skine bare field pallas afterwards got euhe th pallas slew gorgon sacr hist ti commonly held medusa wonderfull faire amazed beheld beauty thence said made stone gorgon came field armed skin mighty serpent diod perhaps put fixion vpon catoblepae liue ouer iles gorgones part mayne mela pliny great beast diuill dangerous slow body great head hanging alwaies downe ground hurt member eye doth basiliske basiliske go armed glass shield brestplates serpent may see himselfe palaphatus tell along tale thing phorcys ethiopian cyrene iland without strayght hercules inhabitant till ground lybia farre riuer amona neare carthage rich gold statue neither consecrated diuided kept treasury possessed course phorcys one faithfull friend whome hee vsed eye perseus fled argo turned pyrat hearing ilands full gold empty men lurked secretly betweene sardinia corsica watching faithfull messenger whome sister vsed still send one another tooke me learnt nothing take mineruas statue vir dring become seruant eye perseus landed shewed would amphion thebanae conditor arcis mouere sono testudinis et prece blanda ducere quo uellet amphion builder theban city ound harpe sweet entising ditty moue stone sayd would lead pliny saith hee inuented musicke lib say harpe also say mercury gaue harpe author lydian tone ualerius probus vpon uirgills saith euripides pacuuius say zetus amphion could gather flockes together pipe witnesse thebe walled apollonius writeth arg zetus b stone place amphion onely piped harped together eusebi maketh inuentors musike euang praep pa yasis alexander say mercury gaue amphion harpe freeing cynara thus farre pro amphion built thebe saith solinus harpe fetched stone thether likely hee brought mountayners hylandmen vnto ciuility helpe worke horace sayth dictus amphion thebanae conditor c may bee song eloquence obteined stone worke ghbours palaephatus saith hee paide stone musicke hauing eusebius maketh zetus liue together two seuerall age vnlesse iber haue falsified first liued vnder linceus reigne time afterwards niobe whose child writer hold famous contro amphions wife daedalus attike saith diod lib sonne eupalamus grandchild daedalus hee rare statuarie excellent architect framing statue seemed th goe witte admirable hee taught talus nephew ut young inuented wimble sawe daedalus greeuing glory arte bee shared another slew youth therefore condemned hee minos creete interteined kindly hee built labyrinth seruius aenead saith hee sonne icarus shutte hee deceiued keeper perswading hee would make excellent worke king made sonne wing flew away icarus flying sunne melted waxen ioyntes hee fell sea beareth lighted sardinia thence salust saith flew cumae temple apollo thus seruius diod others say hee neuer came sardi sicilia whether minos pursued cocalus reigning camarina long discourse bathe held vntill hee choaked le saith crotalus daughter killed hee interpreteth ship poli ee wing whose speed seemed hee flew away diodorus reckoneth many sicilia cocalus intertaining courtesie excellent prouerbe call delicate building daedalean worke nonlatin alphabet c vnder feete footestoole daedalean worke passe calleth honey combes daedalean house geo circe hee calleth daeda polit saith statue hee made would goe themselues runne plato memnone vnlesse bound hee loose fu t hee made statue venus mooued quicksiluer arist de anima palaephatus referres distinction feete sta ore icarus cause sea name affirme certainly thing antiquity l oedipus oedipus laius grandchild agenor sonne labdacus king thebe boetia married iocasta creon daughter seeming barren layus desirous child went oracle told hee neede bee forward child owne sonne kill soone iocasta conceiued sonne father made hole bee bored feete cast wood charge gaue poore woman called polybia brought vp tenea towne corinthian teritory grew vp state strength man hardy high minded went oracle know father hee knew hee outcast child layus chance came oracle two meeting neare phoris neither would giue way fell word thence blowes laius slaine say tumulte phocis oedipus hee taking seuerall part iocast widdow vnto came sphynx riddle wooer dissolue hee could haue iocasta kingdome could must dye death riddle creature goeth morning foure feete noone two night three cost many life last came oedipus declared maried ridle mother became king thebe sphynx brake necke cliffe oedipus hauing child mother last knew whome hee maried whome slaine wherevpon hee pulled owne eye sonnes went gether eares kingdome thus much diod strabo sophocles seneca written tragedyes hee called oedipus quasi nonlatin alphabet swollen fete sphynx saith hesiod begot betwne typhon chymaera ausonius gryphiis make triple ynx shape womanfaced griffinwinged lyonfooted word illa etiam thalamos per trina aenigmata querens qui bipes quadrupes foret tr pe omnia solus terruit aoniam volucris virgo triformis sphinx volucris penni pedibus fera fronte pulla mariage seeking ridles three one might two three fourefooted threeshaped bird beast made greece distrest sphinx maidfacd fetherdfoule fourefooted beast indeed sphynx bloudy minded woman fell saith eusebius pandion time argiues argonautes time palaephatus saith cad hauing put away wife harmonia shee tooke mountaine sphynx boeotia roust boeotians much mischiefe boeotians called treachery aenig riddle oedipus corynth ouercame slew l truth nothing nothing inuented saith lactant admetus hellgods complayning ioue asculapius diminished kingdome reuiuing dead men hee killed thunderbolt father apollo mad shot cyclops ioues thundermakers death ioue greatly would haue thrust apollo heauen latona intreaty hee onely bound hi yeare prenti vnto mortall hee came thessaly heardsman vnto king admetus therefore called nonius pastorall orph flacc argonaut higi saith killed cyclops onely sterope admetus sayled ar te apollo loued wel kept heards lay daughter lact ee apollo gaue arcadian lawes called nomius weth contrarie p father liber diodorus strabo pliny philostratus oets almost doe recorde diodor philost giue reason fable e ioues thigh armie sore infected malady india lead higher wholesome ayre hee recouered dians called femur thigh grew fable q conquered time witte pandion remooued seate argiue recorde deedes liber pater indian actaeon persus ouercame liber slew dinarc poet beleeue let view tombe liber delphos neere statue apollo hee painted ffiminate shape hee lead woman well men philocerus saith liber thus farre eusebius clemens contra th tytans pulled peeces began roaste boyle pallas gotte away apollo ioues command buryed sonne ioue danae persia name hee warred admirable good fortune oros holde greekes xenophon atticus perseaus daughter caephus phaenix sonne cassiopeia shee bound andromeda ke command apollo oracle seamonster deuoure pa ding weeping ouer perseus comming gorgon warres hearing g stood bargained hee marry virgin slew presenting gorgon head vnto afterwards placed eu hath nineteene starres backe vrsa minor circle arctike brest part constellation euer setteth shoulder cassio chaire hath thirteene starres milken circle diuides heauens motion turnes heeles vpwards saith higinus shee fairer nereid andromeda deified minerua prefer countrey friend shee next cassiopeia hath twentie constellation head vnder pegasus belly tropike cancer brest left arme perseus hath seauenteene starres right hand e circle arctike foote stand vpon arcturus head read iulius aratus solensis ioppa syria saith mela lib built deluge inhabitant say cepheus reigned doe keepe diuerse old altar p ineus great reuerence also huge bone sea monster slew hierom marcus scaurus saith pliny lib edileship amongst sight shewed bone monster haue deuoured andro ing fortie foote length longest elephant ribbe india la rence valla errour thicker back bone hee brought ioppe towne iudaea writer say ioppe iudaea therefore wonder lawrence ualla opinion hee taxeth ierome ignorance placing india pliny mela side better credite geographie ouid ose verse much purpose first swartie browne aethiopia egypt later ualla himselfe mistaketh sto came mauritania iudaea aegypt along coast africa hee andromeda thence hee went euphrates coun greekes call persia thence india home argo affraide fearing blast heauen impious fabu theologicall poet chap hat time liued poet called theologian versifying menmade god world element true god kes principality power whome god merite aduanced god make fable contained thing concerned true god layd hugger mugger rest hee neither bee discer false god therby could take direction giue whole onely due must need worshippe creature god god creator yet could abstaine disgracing god ob bles orpheus museus lynus onely god seruants made god themselues though orpheus know meanes hath gotten b ruling infernall sacrifice rather sacriledges citty deuill c wife also cast selfe headlong sea child mel rtes yet reputed god others time also castor pollux ino called greekes l ucothea latines mat held goddesse part l vives orpheus musaeus li liued together little warres troy orpheus thracian sonne ager say apollo calliope orpheus afiction deriued delicate vaine artapanus sayth learnt moyses law maister egypt diod sayth hee brought bacchanalia egipt greece taught thebanes vsed curteously beast stone follow musicke report armony perswaded destenies returne hi euridice thus poet fable bacchae slew wherefore man knoweth say hee seene sacrifice liber others praise god hell hee left liber others hee iudged calliope lye adonis one halfe yeare uenus another rudged uenus therefore woman fell vpon killed hee torne peeces saith higin lib harpe placed heauen belly towards circle arcticke aristotle saith man others say crotone pysi tratus time tyran athens author argonautic linus sonne mercury vrania hermod apollo sonne saith virgill hee first inuented musike greece diod hee taught hercules harpe du le therevpon often chiden sometimes striken linus one time vp harpe knockt maisters braynes say hee slayne one apolloes shaftes suidas reckneth three musaei one borne eleusis sonne antiphe scholler orpheus hee wrot ethi e verse vnto eumolpus another theban sonne thamyras hee wrot himnes ode warres troy third farre hee dyed phal attica epitaph mentioneth say hee maister eleusine ceremony hercules admitted said held greekes called moyses vnlesse eusebius bee herein corrupted b ruling infernall held goe hell cambyses one obscure birth hee called cyrus riuer cyrus persia cyrus nere brought vp hee foyled grandfather warre tooke monarchy medes placing persia conquered chaldaea also hauing gotten monarchy themselues sardanapalus death king crowned babilon nabuchodrosor royall ruler exploytes extoll aboue chaldean hercules actes saying hee conquering mye farre gades strabo ex megasthene megasthenes sayth alphaeus affirmes nabuchodrosor stouter soldier hercules hee conquered libya asia farre armenia returning home cryed manner prophecying babilonians presage great misfortune shall befall neither three head three definition one onely true one chap therefore three sort life contemplatiue actiue mixt question obserue doe meddle finall good easie hard attainement good accompanieth three seuerall course beeing attained finall good doth immediatly make attainer blessed neither contemplation action two proportioned together maketh man blessed one may liue three fashion yet bee farre wide true doe meddle nature good euill wherefore varro hauing recited last foure whereby whole summe opinion amounteth two hundred eighty eight worthy name sect make mention good chiefly desired leaueth returneth first twelue whose controuersie maine point man chiefe good gather one direct truth shew rest false first remooues three sort life carry two part number remaines ninety sixe go cynikes carry academikes whose sect varro stand wholy better calling accident plainely euill haue one foule errour hold life endureth euills blessed hee rid himselfe owne voluntary destruction paine torment body euill say greater worse avoyde must willingly betake selfe death leaue life life encombred euills blessed amongst many euills must bee avoyded call blessed may abandon euills list death power diuine hold dying keepe continually euills would say wretched life indeed well soone leauing maketh misery eternall selfe would iudge miserable quit misery therefore short much lesse happynesse misery short must needes forcible euill hath power make man nay wise man owne executioner truely said themselues nature first forcible precept man haue deare respect himselfe therefore avoyde hand death naturall instinct beefriend himselfe hee still desire bee liuing creature enioy coniunction soule body mighty euills subdue natural instinct al men desire aviod death subduing farre abhorred desired rather wanted effected man owne hand mighty mischiefe maketh fortitude homicide bee bee called fortitude yeeldeth euills faine force kill himselfe auoyde inconueniences whome hath vndertaken defend whether hee guilty though hee bee b innocent yet suffereth assured paine assured hee faulty case iudges ignorance turnes prisoner miserie nay lamentable deserueth sea teares washe away iudge torturing accused least hee put death innocent oftentimes wretched ignorance killeth party innocent torture whome hee tortured auoyde killing innocent according vnto doctrine hee rather leaue life endure misery hee saith presently hee thing whereof hee cleare indeed beeing therevpon condemned executed still iudge cannot tell whether hee guilty hee tortured least hee execute guiltlesse meanes killed ere hee knew hee guilty mist mortall societie whether shall iudge sitte yes hee must sitte hee bound place hee holdeth wickednesse discharge state command hee must obey hee neuer hold wickednesse torture giue vnto either vpon good euill cause vnto onely end wherein peace shall haue end thing superior vnto goodnesse perfection beatitude eternall peace true perfection wherein saint installed chap wee may therefore say peace finall good sayd life eternall psalme saith vnto citty whereof write laborious worke prayse thy lord ierusalem praise thy lord zion hee hath made fast barres thy gate blessed thy child within thee hee hath made peace thy border barres gate fast none come none goe therefore peace wee call finall border bound citty misticall name hereof ierusalem signifieth vision peace name peace ordinary world eternity resident therefore wee choose rather call bound chiefe good citty lieth life eternall rather peace end apostle saith beeing freed sinne made seruants rom god haue fruite holynesse end euerlasting life otherside ignorant scripture may take euerlasting life ill sence life wicked eternally euill either philosopher held soule cannot die faith teacheth torment cannot cease vvhich hee marketh man affaire generall forme nature confesse ioy peace desired like men warrior would conquer warres ayme nothing glorious peace victory suppression resistants beeing done peace followeth peace warres purpose scope military discipline limmite iust contention leuell men seeke peace war none seekes warre peace perturbe peace liue e shew power alteration would disanull would strong suttle haue fellow plaieth part roguery alone yet hee neither cut li make knowne fact vnto must need hold kinde peace home wife family must need obserue quietnesse questionlesse delighteth put theeuish forme put king albeit couetousnesse malice remained vnchanged thus see men desire haue peace would haue liue according liking wage warre would make owne could conquere giue lawes like b let v imagine insociable fellow poet fable recordeth calling c halfeman inhumaine barbarisme although kingdome lay lightlesse caue villanies rare gaue great name cacus euill though wife neuer good word hee neuer plaied child ruled manlier age neuer spake friend much e father vulcan farre happy begot monster vulcan begetting though hee neuer gaue robbed reaued hee could gripe manner person yea f person themselues yet horred dungeon whose flore wall alwaies danke bloud new slaughter hee desired nothing rest peace therein without molestation desired also bee peace himselfe hee enioyed ruled ouer owne bodie satisfie owne hungry nature menaced seperation soule body fell robbery celerity though barbarous bloudie yet care prouide life safety therefore hee would haue peace others caue himselfe alone hee neither haue beene called halfeman monster horrible shape breathing fire made men avoide necessity made liue caue play thiefe liuing man hee poet faigne vnlesse mightily belied cacus sufficiently haue h commended hercules sayd like man truth many fiction wild beast part whose brutishnesse place doe preserue peace kinde begetting breeding liuing together amongst themselues beeing otherwise insociable birth desert speake sheepe deere pigeon stare bee lion fox eagle owles tyger doth nousle yong sawn vpon tendernesse kite though fly ily prey wil tread female build nest sit egges seed young assist fellow motherly duety lieth farre stronger band binde man vnto society peace peaceable worst men doe fight fellowes quietnesse would lay power reduce distinct forme state drawne themselues whereof would head could neuer bee coherence either feare loue herein peruerse pride imitator goodnesse god hauing equality others selfe vnder laying yoake obedience vpon fellowes distinguish godlie peace wicked peruerse confusion must bee reformed better disposing thing wherein bee example hang man vp head downewards al posture confouded lowest hauing highest place contrary desireth bee placed peace nature weight seeming demand place rest though life gone yet nature swayeth vnto order wherein shee placed dead body bee preserued putrefaction vnguents embalmings yet n follow ordinance law disposing al thing congruently forme nature soeuer changed l vives generall forme community nature scholians say wee must neuer respect word matter diuinity philosophy auouch inclination men missinterpretation word hath made foule worke artes first cankring directly killing b imagine uirgils cacus aeneid hee ouercome saith dionysius hercules hee dwelt impregnable place whence hee plagued dwelt neere hearing hercules encamped nere hee stole droue away great prey greekes iniured strength dwelt saith solinus salinae port trigemina stand beeing put saith gellius prison tarchon tyrrhene prince whilest hee embassador ale phrigian ruled marsias brake prison came home fortifying vulturnum campania presumed encroch vpon arcadian hercules protected therevpon slew thus seruius saith fable reported sonne uulcan breathed fire destroyed hee came neare truth theeuish villenous seruant euanders sister caca betrayed therefore chappell erected vnto wherein vestalls offered sacrifice lactant c halfeman uirgil seruius call cacus diodorus saith proper name l uius copy bee true lib e father vulcan virg ouid fast others call hee burnt vp corne wasted field fire f person whose head set vppe mouth caue uirg ouid g breatheing firebreathing cacus uirgil call h commended hercules one whose labour death cacus cacus stole part spanish kine drew caue tailes least tract step nousle yong loueth young dearely plin l kite rauenous meager foule seene winter solisticies hath gout feete plin l aristotle hath one strang note eagle breed goe kind hatched ospreyes osprey hatcheth faithfull preseuere saying let holdeth hold thus take place vntill hee bee taken way vntill antichrist troupe vnreuealed mistery iniquity depart midst church vnto doe hold saint iohns word belong babe heretiques calleth many antichrist went church likewise hereafter belong vnto christ vnto last antichrist shall depart middest christ flocke shall man sinne bee reuealed thus one taketh apostle wordes povver signes lying vvonders deceiuiablenesse vnrighteousnesse amongst perish shall sathan bee let loose vvorke antichrist vnto men admiration yet falshood doubt whither bee called lying wonder hee doth delude eye miracle doth hee seemes doe although may bee reall action yet end drawe ignorant mankinde false conceite thing could bee done diuine power know deuill shall haue power giuen euer fire
